result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Allan Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Jacob Allan
defendant.address: N 4374 Hector Dam Rd., Shell Lake, WI 54871

records.addlTxt: Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Bond to continue.
Court questions the defendant. Court finds the defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviews file. Argument. Court finds probable cause.

2:03 PM Defendant Jacob Allan Peterson in court.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel Repka appears via video for the defendant. Court calls case and appearances. Defendant approves for his attorney to appear via zoom. Atty Repka states it will be a waiver.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea hearing on December 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.

2:20 PM Defendant Jacob Allan Peterson in court.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Jacob Allan Peterson. Court calls all cases and appearances. No agreement reached at this time. Status/Prelim's set on 9/7-Defendant to appear in person.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

10:08 AM Defendant Jacob Allan Peterson in court.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel Repka appears via video for the Defendant. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Waived time limits. Set for preliminary hearing-Defendant to appear in person. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:00 PM Defendant Jacob A Peterson in court, in custody. Assistant District Attorney Christian Ness appeared in person. Attorney Daniel Repka appeared by video for the defendant. Court calls case and appearances. The Court questions the DE. Atty Ness requests $500 cash bond with same previous bond conditions. Atty Repka makes bond argument. The Court orders additional $500 cash bond. No contact except by text (non-abusive only) or supervised contact during treatment or therapy settings. Moving previous case statuses to track with this new case. Adjourned.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
